body:
### Problem

After commit 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2 some keys (for example Tab and Backspace) are being repeated. For example in normal mode, when deleting work using backspace two alphabets are being deleted.

### Steps to reproduce

build vim from master (after 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2)
Type in some sentences, insert normal mode, try deleting using backspace.

### Expected behavior

Keys are not repeated (or only one alphabet is removed deleted when using backspace)

As it used to be before commit 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2 was merged.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1444+g4fb3b57a19

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No

### Operating system/version

Linux

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.14.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

From git

comment_data.body:
Alacritty is likely sending repeat events for Enter, Tab, and Backspace, which they should not be doing in accordance with the spec https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/keyboard-protocol/#report-event-types

You can confirm this by installing `kitty` and, in Alacritty, running `printf '\x1b[>3u' ; kitty +kitten show_key`. When you press Enter, Backspace, or Tab you _should_ see only one key press for each, not two (you'll have to force kill this command or close the window since it won't be possible to Ctrl-C out of it).
I can confirm; on kitty and gnome terminal this does not happen.
If you file an issue with Alacritty, please link it here so other users can track it. I'm going to close this one since there's nothing actionable on Nvim's side.
https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/8385

So the issue was reproducible with foot terminal too.

Edit: So far only gnome terminal and kitty seems to work.
foot has the same bug https://codeberg.org/dnkl/foot/issues/1892
I have the issue on kitty @listout. Which version did you test on? I have 0.31.0.
Yes, that version is too old, as the discussion in the linked alacritty issue should make clear. You need to update (current is 0.38.1).
Yeah, my bad. Hand't realised I hadn't updated kitty in a while.

The version of Alacritty and Foot in the Ubuntu LTS release are currently `0.13.2` and `1.16.2-2ubuntu0.1` respectively (old versions with broken duplicate key behaviour).

Releasing Neovim `0.11` as is will break a lot people's working setup in a very weird way. 

Running nightly for the first time today (normally `0.10.X` user) resulted in me going down a rabbit hole of _"what the heck is going on, I can't backspace now without multiple characters being deleted???"_.

Also note, Alacritty does **not** release a Debian or Linux binary package ready for easy installation. So just telling folks to upgrade Alacritty on Linux is not as easy as it sounds. Ubuntu snaps are not viable either (at least for me) since Linux Mint (Ubuntu derivative) disables Snaps.

Is there no way at all to provide compatibility for folks running older versions of Alacritty and Foot provided by their Linux distribution of choice? If not, then maybe a startup warning message or `:checkhealth` message?

This will cause grief if released as is.
We will temporarily disable key event reporting before the 0.11 release and then re-enable it on nightly again afterwards.
Quite reasonable indeed, thanks @gpanders, a very good strategy (for near term).

I just started having this issue on Ubuntu 22.04, Kitty 0.31.0, Neovim 0.11.0-dev.

I saw the suggestion above to update Kitty to the latest version (currently 0.39.1), so I did that, and that fixed the issue.

after seeing the linked PR for alacritty, https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/8385,  I assumed updating to latest alacritty (15.1) would resolve..  But still seeing the same duplicate keypress behavior on latest nvim 
```
NVIM v0.11.0-dev
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
```
Are folks still seeing this issue?

> Are folks still seeing this issue?

I'm on alacritty 0.15.1 and I don't see the issue anymore.
@fedreg-bn I'm also getting this after updating alacritty for alacritty `v0.15.1` and `0.16.0-dev` with neovim `v0.11.0-dev`
@listout thanks!  Are you also running nvim `v0.11.0-dev`?

> [@listout](https://github.com/listout) thanks! Are you also running nvim `v0.11.0-dev`?

Yes

```
NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1785+gb0bbe25c48
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1736781742
```

Still experiencing this issue with following versions:

NVIM v0.11.0-dev
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1703358377

alacritty 0.15.1

I had the same problem: Enter, Backspace, and Tab keys were repeating unexpectedly only in Neovim, and only when Alacritty was set as the default terminal (e.g., via update-alternatives).

Turns out it was an environment issue — Alacritty wasn’t launching Neovim with a compatible $TERM, which caused the weird input behavior.

Solution: Create a wrapper for Alacritty that sets the correct $TERM

Create a script at ~/.local/bin/alacritty-wrapper:
```bach
#!/bin/bash
env TERM=xterm-256color alacritty "$@"
```
Make it executable:
```bash
chmod +x ~/.local/bin/alacritty-wrapper
```

Set it as the default terminal:
```bash
sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/x-terminal-emulator x-terminal-emulator ~/.local/bin/alacritty-wrapper 100
sudo update-alternatives --config x-terminal-emulator
```

labels.description: Needs a third-party / external change or fix
labels.name: status:blocked-external

title: On alacritty some keys are being repeated
